text.body: Promising new findings use controversial experimental drug called Interleukin as cure cancer be published April issue prestigious New England Journal Medicine according to Wall Street analyst who obtained advance copy magazine Among interleukin s principal U S makers Cetus Corp CTUS headquartered Emeryville Calif Immunex Corp IMNX based Seattle Wash journal to be released late today contains two articles reporting high remission rates several cancer types journal also contains signed editorial concluding new results mark significant milestone search successful immunotherapy cancer Interleukin also known as IL substance naturally produced by living cells laboratory drug controversial because widely praised as promising cancer treatment early reports on effectiveness late only to come under criticism year later failure to live up to promise due to ravaging side effects One new studies conducted by Dr William West Biotherapeutics Inc Franklin Tenn particularly significant because found far fewer harsh side effects after changed way drug administered study researchers administered IL to cancer patients found pct remission rate kidney cancers pct remission rate melanoma type skin cancer according to Prudential Bache Securities Stuart Weisbrod who obtained advance copy magazine rectal colon cancer researchers found no remissions but none patients treated side effects serious enough to be placed under intensive hospital care according to article second study whose principal author Dr Steven Rosenberg National Cancer Institute researchers administered IL to cancer patients found pct remission rate cancers kidney pct rate melanomas pct rate cancers colon rectum National Cancer Institute trials total four patients died magazine reported confirming harshness drug s side effects as originally administered Perhaps we at end beginning search successful immunotherapy cancer editorial signed by John Durant Philadelphia s Chase Cancer Center These observations reported by Rosenberg West surely did describe successful practical approaches ready widespread applications therapy cancer patients editorial On other hand if they reflect as seems possible successful manipulation cellular immune system then we may be near end our search meaningful direction immunuotherapy cancer editorial concluded

text.title: FURTHER ARGENTINE COARSE GRAIN LOSSES FEARED
text.author: By Manuel Villanueva
text.body: Argentine grain producers adjusted their yield estimates coarse grain crop downward week to yesterday after heavy rains at end March beginning April trade sources They sunflower maize sorghum production estimates been reduced despite some later warm dry weather allowed return to harvesting some areas However as showers fell intermittently after weekend producers feared another spell prolonged intense rain could cause more damage to crops already badly hit season Rains middle week reached average millimetres parts Buenos Aires province mm Cordoba Santa Fe Entre Rios Misiones Corrientes eight Chaco Formosa There no rainfall same period La Pampa Producers feared continued damp conditions could produce rotting lead to still lower yield estimates all crops including soybean However as lands began drying later week harvesting advanced considerably reaching between pct area sown case sunflower Deterioration sunflower crop evident harvested material Cordoba La Pampa Buenos Aires forced yield estimates per hectare to be adjusted down again season s sunflowerseed production now forecast at to tonnes against to forecast week down to pct on record Area sown to sunflowers two to hectares to pct below record hectares season Maize harvesting also reached to pct area sown near completion Cordoba Santa Fe begin La Pampa southern Buenos Aires later April Production estimates maize were down week at to tonnes against to estimated previously to pct below to tonnes estimated by private sources crop to pct down on official figure tonnes Maize sown on to hectares two to seven pct down on season s Sorghum harvested on to pct area sown Cordoba Santa Fe Chaco Harvest start La Pampa Buenos Aires mid April total area sown to hectares to pct down on sown season new forecast sorghum crop to tonnes compared three to forecast week to pct down on season s to tonne crop soybean crop season adjusted remaining at record to tonnes up to pct on to estimated by private sources to pct higher than official figure area sown to soybeans season record to hectares to pct up on record sown soybean crop showing excessive moisture some areas producers fear they may discover more damage Some experimental harvesting carried out Santa Fe on areas making up only one pct total crop but details on were available Preparation fields wheat crop be sown between May August or September so far been as intense as previous years

reuters.unknown: F Y f reute d f BC petrochemical

text.title: ENERGY U S PETROCHEMICAL INDUSTRY
text.author: By JULIE VORMAN Reuters
text.body: Cheap oil feedstocks weakened U S dollar plant utilization rate approaching pct propel streamlined U S petrochemical industry to record profits year growth expected through at least major company executives predicted bullish outlook chemical manufacturing industrywide move to shed unrelated businesses prompted GAF Corp GAF privately held Cain Chemical Inc other firms to aggressively seek acquisitions petrochemical plants Oil companies such as Ashland Oil Inc ASH Kentucky based oil refiner marketer also shopping money making petrochemical businesses to buy I see us poised at threshold golden period Paul Oreffice chairman giant Dow Chemical Co DOW adding There s no major plant capacity being added around world now whole game bringing out new products improving old ones Analysts say chemical industry s biggest customers automobile manufacturers home builders use lot paints plastics expected to buy quantities year U S petrochemical plants currently operating at pct capacity reflecting tighter supply could hike product prices by to pct year John Dosher managing director Pace Consultants Inc Houston Demand some products such as styrene could push profit margins up by as much as pct he Oreffice speaking at meeting chemical engineers Houston Dow easily top dlrs earned year predicted best year history when oil prices were still above dlrs barrel chemical exports were adversely affected by strong U S dollar Dow profits dlrs I believe entire chemical industry headed record year or close to Oreffice GAF chairman Samuel Heyman estimated U S chemical industry report pct gain profits during year domestic industry earned total billion dlrs pct leap turn fortunes once sickly chemical industry been brought by combination luck planning Pace s John Dosher Dosher year s fall oil prices made feedstocks dramatically cheaper at same time American dollar weakening against foreign currencies helped boost U S chemical exports Also helping to bring supply demand into balance been gradual market absorption extra chemical manufacturing capacity created by Middle Eastern oil producers early s Finally virtually all major U S chemical manufacturers embarked on extensive corporate restructuring program to mothball inefficient plants trim payroll eliminate unrelated businesses restructuring touched off flurry friendly hostile takeover attempts GAF made unsuccessful attempt to acquire Union Carbide Corp UK recently offered three billion dlrs Borg Warner Corp BOR Chicago manufacturer plastics chemicals Another industry powerhouse W R Grace GRA divested retailing restaurant fertilizer businesses to raise cash chemical acquisitions But some experts worry chemical industry may be headed trouble if companies continue turning their back on manufacturing staple petrochemical commodities such as ethylene favor more profitable specialty chemicals custom designed small group buyers Companies like DuPont DD Monsanto Co MTC spent past two or three years trying to get out commodity chemical business reaction to how badly market deteriorated Dosher But I think they eventually kill margins on profitable chemicals niche market Some top who previously led leveraged buyout Dupont s Conoco Inc s chemical business spent billion dlrs since January to buy seven petrochemical plants along Texas Gulf Coast plants produce only basic reuters.unknown: A RM f reute u f BC DEFICIT CUTS SEEN UNA

text.title: DEFICIT CUTS SEEN UNABLE TO CURE TRADE DEFICIT
text.author: By Irwin Arieff
text.body: Financial analysts say they pleased congressional moves to trim next year s federal budget deficit but believe actions do little to help improve U S trade deficit or buoy economy House Representatives expected to vote tomorrow to approve trillion dollar budget blueprint coming fiscal year reduces deficit by billion dlrs Similarly Senate Budget Committee approved plan cut federal red ink by billion dlrs next year In terms economy billion dlrs infinitesimal so cuts magnitude little impact on economy trade deficit Stanley Collander Touche Ross federal budget policy analyst At best small positive effect Collander interview Federal Reserve Board Chairman Paul Volcker repeatedly told Congress cutting federal red ink go long way to help reduce massive trade deficit also help ease some downward pressure on value dollar U S government attempted to remedy trade imbalance by driving down value dollar But Volcker warned further fall dollar s value fraught danger Such decline he could refuel inflation as imported goods become more expensive chase away foreign capital needed to finance federal budget deficit addition February U S officials meeting other major industrialized nations Paris agreed value dollar dropped enough world exchange rates should be stabilized at around current levels As part agreement Japan West Germany agreed to take steps to stimulate their economies United States agreed to cut budget deficit alternative to driving down dollar any further as way to deal trade deficit Volcker recently to reduce U S consumption particularly federal spending If you don t deal budget deficit everything else you do going to be counterproductive Volcker recent testimony before Senate Banking Committee Volcker also he prefer to further tighten government s purse strings than Fed tighten credit supply if action needed to fight inflationary pressures or to assure continued flow foreign capital into United States Analysts say Fed tightening now could choke off current modest economic expansion threaten recession Kemper Financial Services economist John Silvia stressed any deficit reduction better than none But he size cuts under consideration were enough to give Federal Reserve Board flexibility needs to steer economy or to keep value dollar plunging further world exchange markets There s no doubt some deficit reduction helps but if your objective to stabilize dollar perserve Fed s flexibility to conduct monetary policy then answer s enough Silvia told Reuters U S trade deficit become one government s most vexing persistent problems deficit billion dlrs there as yet little indication year s figure be any lower though administration officials predicted drop by to billion dlrs by year s end past Volcker joked he never lost sleep worrying whether Congress cut too much fat federal budget On other hand he also made clear he attached to gradually declining deficit ceilings set period by year s Gramm Rudman balanced budget law While new law set ceiling billion dlrs next year s federal deficit both House Senate Budget Committees conceded their budget plans fall short deficit reduction goal by billion dlrs For political reasons to billion dlrs most you re going to get out Congress at present time Touche Ross s Collander To do something more than be extraordinary remarkable very very difficult Collander real danger Congress to end up short deficit reduction goal set by Budget panels To extent become minimum acceptable reduction level he explained Anything less than now look like failure to Wall Street budget plan now under debate on House floor lower estimated billion dlr deficit year beginning on October one to billion dlrs by cutting defense domestic programs by billion dlrs their anticipated spending levels next year Senate Budget Committee called deficit nearly billion dlrs billion dlrs new taxes same amount spending cuts

text.title: FUNARO SAYS BRAZIL S CREDITORS MUST TRUST HIM
text.body: Brazilian Finance Minister Dilson Funaro who suspended interest payments to creditor banks two months ago creditors to trust him when he Brazil achieve trade surplus large enough to continue servicing debt Speaking to reporters at Brazilian Embassy Funaro he seek approval Brazil s economic program outside his country but added At same time we show credibility you the banks going to to trust us Asked if creditor banks accept Brazil s refinancing needs based on new economic program endorsed by International Monetary Fund Funaro What other options do they They to try to see our program Funaro who Washington to attend Interim Committee Development Committee meetings World Bank IMF he unveiled his refinancing proposals to major creditor banks New York yesterday According to Funaro creditor banks agreed on need to find solution to crisis He did elaborate Funaro commercial banks agreed on Brazil s need economic growth added creditors were aware Brazil cannot continue to export billion dlrs net capital transferred over past three years He also he told bankers Brazil s needs to ensure seven pct average growth eight billion to billion dlr trade surplus until Administration officials familiar negotiations Brazil s new economic measures did make much sense based on current conditions country added they saw long difficult negotiations ahead Lewis Preston chairman J P Morgan Co Inc told Reuters he remains hopeful Brazil foreign bank creditors reach debt rescheduling agreement before end year But Preston who did attend meeting between Funaro creditor banks yesterday added onus still on Brazil to put economic house order first They haven t even come up plan yet Preston after Morgan s annual meeting New York today Funaro however most creditor banks representatives Brazil who were well aware Brazil s new economic measures designed to curb surge inflation spending sharp drop exports Funaro called Brazil s program very responsible very strong adding it very different other years there been tremendous change Based on Brazil s current economic situation suspension interest payments on billion dlrs owed to banks pct inflation need four reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC BUNDESBANK CALLS FOR

text.title: BUNDESBANK CALLS FOR CENTRAL BANK COOPERATION
text.body: Bundesbank board member Claus Koehler called on central banks major industrialised nations to cooperate closely on exchange interest rate policies lecture at University Surrey pre released here Koehler only alternative to cooperation protectionism control on capital movements Central banks sufficient experience exchange market transactions to steer exchange rates where they want to them he He added West German growth forecasts to be revised downward because recent dollar drop to marks above two marks at start Koehler transactions on foreign exchange markets parted company transactions goods services investments scale speculative transactions determined market trends Speculative inflows could cause monetary aggregates to grow To reverse such rise money stock interest rates to be lowered to allow funds to drain off In other words monetary policy measures required different sometimes diametrically opposed to those needed when money stock increasing as result mounting economic activity Koehler dollar fall one means reducing massive U S Current account deficit But attempts to keep depreciation going by talking dollar down posed problems sharp drop dollar led to immediate steep rise cost U S Imports sharp fall cost European imports But volume effect falling imports to U S rising imports to Europe take time to make itself felt compared price effect Hence depreciation dollar may well be going further than be necessary to adjust current account over medium term Koehler reduction U S Current account deficit occur only if growth rate GNP higher than domestic demand Japan West Germany by contrast domestic demand should rise faster than GNP In Germany did indeed happen Koehler If further appreciation dollar to be prevented U S Current account deficit could be offset by inflow foreign funds into U S But only if there appropriate interest rate differential Europe Japan look financial investment U S When selecting monetary policy instruments central bank to pay greater heed than past to impact measures might on expectations consequent decisions Koehler Bundesbank changing money market rates by operating on open market rather than adjusting leading interest rates because signal gives to market substantial impact on exchange rates only important to achieve domestic goals price stability economic growth full employment but also to tackle international problems like exchange rate problem debt problem current account problem strategy to be designed helped the safeguarding non inflationary economic growth international monetary system largely free disruptions Koehler Given system floating exchange rates necessary central banks to agree to intervene sufficed to tell market where central banks saw exchange rates over next few years intervention points should be set because they were only testing points market he order to keep international monetary system free disruptions central banks should only intervene jointly but also cooperate on interest rate policies Koehler

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC N Z GOVERNMENT POPUL

text.title: N Z GOVERNMENT POPULARITY RISES AHEAD OF ELECTION
text.author: By Christopher Pritchett Reuters
text.body: New Zealand s ruling Labour Party government just completed three year economic reform threw thousands people out work yet popularity risen as September deadline election draws closer recent poll shows Eyewitness Heylen Poll conducted Television New Zealand s Eyewitness news broadcast on April showed Labour support pct voters compared opposition National Party s pct figures been reversed poll month earlier poll showed pct canvassed voters thought economy improve over next year up points on month s result increase came week when government turned seven departments into nine profit oriented corporations run by businessmen who promptly sacked some employees including half country s coal miners latest survey confounded those who proclaimed Labour s days were numbered because perceived insensitivity to traditional backers workers political analysts poll indicates people swinging behind party arguments Finance Minister Roger Douglas who presided over deregulation economy construction one based on market forces without subsidies or currency controls analysts economic reforms by party increasingly regarded New Zealand as more akin to West European style Social Democrats than working class socialists rattled National Party now regretting as innovative decade ruled until Prime Minister Robert Muldoon ousted one analyst National Party further shaken analyst when Press Christchurch daily on April party on verge flying apart prospect coup attempt against leader Jim Bolger by Muldoon Bolger article April Fool s joke Labour s reforms brought unexpectedly strong tax revenues lower budget deficit less state borrowing improvement balance payments reduction foreign debt improved productivity economists Inflation should peak at pct quarter ended March fall to eight pct within year they Labour s reforms hit every sector but most dramatic corporatisation seven government departments on April critics argue first stage step towards sale state assets analysts move stops short privatisation as state retain ownership but new corporations expected to be financially self supporting pay dividends Arguments already broken out over money One utility Electricorp assets worth less than billion dlrs yet Treasury wants billion them No agreement been reached on value assets former forest service analysts added Chairman Alan Gibbs speech forest service been losing dlrs annually yet due to economies now employed less than pct previous workforce new corporation pay state dividend at least dlrs first year Uncertainties also arisen over government as only shareholder retaining right to order new corporations to undertake certain projects although full cost must be met by state analysts Deputy prime minister Geoffrey Palmer managers be held accountable performance government paying projects undertaken social or environmental reasons policy already caused problems analysts added example Electricorp refused to spend several hundred million dlrs to build hydro project at Luggate further up Clutha river Clyde high dam now under construction Central Otago Prime Minister David Lange week Labour MPs decided year Luggate be built important government honour promises But also matter importance we do see many more jobs lost because economic distortion than we save by having promise honoured to he added

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT TELECOM IS KEY JAPAN MINISTRY
text.author: By Linda Sieg Reuters
text.body: Japan s little known Ministry Posts Telecommunications MPT emerged as international force to be reckoned political analysts MPT thrust into spotlight by trade rows U S Britain position strength due to control lucrative industry ties important politicians they The ministry standing athwart regulatory control key industrial sector telecommunications information one diplomatic source They potent political force diplomatic source But MPT finding domestic political prowess does always help when comes to trade friction diplomacy analysts The ministry minor ministry people were so internationalized Waseda University professor Mitsuru Uchida Suddenly they re standing at centre world community sense they re at loss as to how to face situation Most recently ministry been embroiled row London over efforts by Britain s Cable Wireless Plc to keep major stake one two consortia trying to compete Japan s lucrative overseas telephone business ministry favoured merger two rival groups arguing market cannot support more than one competitor to Kokusai Denshin Denwa Co Ltd now monopolizes business also opposed major management role planned merger any non Japanese overseas telecommunications firm on grounds no such international precedent exists ministry s stance outraged both London threatened to retaliate Washington says merger plan evidence Japan s failure to honour pledges to open telecommunications market Washington also angry over other ministry moves says limited access U S Firms to Japan s car telephone satellite communications market Much MPT s new prominence stems growth sector regulates What been happening important shift economy makes ministry very important place James Abegglen head consulting firm Asia Advisory Service Inc decision to open telecommunications industry to competition under new set laws passed boosted rather than lessened MPT s authority analysts With legal framework eased they became de facto legal framework Bache Securities Japan analyst Darrell Whitten Close links powerful political faction ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP nurtured by former Prime Minister Kakuei Tanaka another key to MPT s influence analysts Other factions ignored MPT in s but Tanaka faction forward looking Recognized importance MPT Uchida Many former bureaucrats became members influential political group he added ministry also power financial sector due to more than billion yen worth deposits Postal Savings System analysts MPT helped block Finance Ministry plans to deregulate interest rates on small deposits key element financial liberalisation since change remove Postal Savings System s ability to offer slightly higher rates than banks they Diplomatic sources frustrated what they see as MPT s obstructionist protectionist posture characterized ministry as feudal Critics charge MPT protecting own turf limiting competition sheltering former monopolies under wing Providing consumers best service at lowest price takes back seat to such considerations they But many ministry s actions unlike those bureaucratic counterparts much Western world including Britain several analysts The United States really odd man out Abegglen For government to take view wants to keep order utilities markets unusual or unreasonable view he

text.title: MEMBERS OF JAPAN S RULING PARTY SHUN NAKASONE
text.author: By Yuko Nakamikado
text.body: Members prime minister Yasuhiro Nakasone s ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP shunned his support their campaigns upcoming local elections His presence do more harm than good LDP candidate Tokyo told Reuters candidate one several conservatives who rebelled joined public outcry against Nakasone s proposal five pct sales tax Political analysts Nakasone might to step down before Venice summit industrial democracies on June if LDP lost too many major local seats Nakasone s popularity dropped sharply since he led his party to greatest ever election victory July analysts proposed tax one reason decline Over local seats be filled during two rounds polling first round on Sunday second on April Political analysts seat to watch be governorship Fukuoka southern Japan LDP two centre parties challenging incumbent governor Hachiji Okuda who supported by opposition socialist communist parties proposed tax key campaign issue The LDP centrist parties should votes against Okuda But Okuda incumbent sales tax weapon Rei Shiratori professor political science at Dokkyo University Nakasone serve out his term to end October if LDP wins Fukuoka he Analysts believe opposition likely to win governorship northern island Hokkaido But Kenzo Uchida professor political science at Hosei University Nakasone can afford to get fairly tough if LDP loses only Hokkaido opposition parties campaigning to scrap sales tax proposal tax one main pillars Nakasone s plan to overhaul tax system remained unchanged years also key element plans to boost Japanese domestic demand cut back on exports Without tax revenue government less to spend on stimulating economy

text.title: G ISSUES STATEMENT AFTER MEETING
text.body: Following text statement by Group Seven U S Japan West Germany France Britain Italy Canada issued after Washington meeting yesterday finance ministers central bank governors seven major industrial countries met today They continued process multilateral surveillance their economies pursuant to arrangements strengthened economic policy coordination agreed at Tokyo summit their heads state or government managing director International Monetary Fund also participated meeting ministers governors reaffirmed commitment to cooperative approach agreed at recent Paris meeting noted progress achieved implementing undertakings embodied Louvre Agreement They agreed however further actions be essential to resist rising protectionist pressures sustain global economic expansion reduce trade imbalances connection they welcomed proposals just announced by governing Liberal Democratic Party Japan extraordinary urgent measures to stimulate Japan s economy through early implementation large supplementary budget exceeding those previous years as well as unprecedented front end loading public works expenditures government Japan reaffirmed intention to further open up domestic markets to foreign goods services ministers governors reaffirmed view around current levels their currencies within ranges broadly consistent economic fundamentals basic policy intentions outlined at Louvre meeting connection they welcomed strong implementation Louvre Agreement They concluded present prospective progress implementing policy undertakings at Louvre statement provided basis continuing close cooperation to foster stability exchange rates

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC CHINA LIKELY TO JOIN

text.title: CHINA LIKELY TO JOIN GATT DIPLOMATS SAY
text.author: By Mark O Neill Reuters
text.body: China likely to succeed joining GATT despite policies contradict free trade because western countries support entry western diplomats China applied to join General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT July organisation formed to integrate world s free market economies now regulates pct world trade GATT secretariat expected to submit list detailed questions to China next month at start long complex entry negotiations diplomats One diplomat China s prospects good application supported by United States Japan European Community political economic reasons The fear if China refused entry draw back bamboo curtain go back to way he Another Soviet Union waiting wings If GATT accepted China be hard to accept Soviet Union he China s agreement be seen as model Soviet Union GATT political body But serious problems to be tackled during talks including China s pricing system trade subsidies GATT based on free trade aims to lower tariffs promote trade prices alone dictating who buys what One diplomat very hard China to establish real cost goods because many prices set by state often contain subsidies Even when you go person to factory or company to try to find out real cost something officials do give you clear answer political meaning evident They do want to answer he China s position as set out memorandum to GATT February gradually reforming price system to bring prices line real production costs replace administrative controls market ones Another diplomat countries centralised economies such as Hungary Yugoslavia joined GATT However China apply membership on similar terms but rather as less developed country entitled to preferential treatment He added economies Hungary Yugoslavia small while China s huge weight be felt It China world s number two producer coal instance diplomat It could very large impact on world trade Another sticking point subsidies China pays companies to export so can earn foreign exchange to pay vitally needed technology equipment raw materials Japanese trader China lost money on every tonne grain exported because to make up difference between low world price high domestic price western diplomat official foreign trade bureau major inland Chinese city told him export subsidies might be as high as pct some products When I asked what subsidy figure whole country he referred me to Ministry Finance adding grin they tell me he He officials were unwilling to give figures because sensitivity subject Unless something done to change China find many countries GATT putting restrictions on imports China diplomat added major speech on economy late month Planning Minister Song Ping made indirect reference to problem While trying to expand exports to earn more foreign exchange we must improve economic accounting practices reduce cost exports he One diplomat China s freedom to change foreign trade pricing system to bring them more line GATT principles could conflict domestic pressures China there be no major price reforms year following widespread discontent public used to stable prices since Communist takeover So question how fast how thoroughly can China reform economy diplomat How can balance requirements GATT membership domestic political needs But he added advantages China s entry end outweigh these problems China s entry force to modernise become more part world economy he Just as China get increased access to foreign markets so to give more access to domestic market to foreign countries

text.title: G COMMITMENT TESTS JAPAN S WILL TO BOOST ECONOMY
text.author: By Kunio Inoue Reuters
text.body: The statement issued today by Group Seven G industrialised nations put Japan under greater international pressure to stimulate economy or face further rise yen private economists analysts They communique reflected increased foreign frustration Japan s burgeoning trade surplus tight fisted fiscal policies past Unless Japan implements economic measures included statement foreign protectionist sentiment grow yen come under renewed upward pressure they G grouping U S Japan West Germany Britain France Italy Canada statement they welcomed proposals announced by Japan s ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP extraordinary urgent measures to stimulate economy Japan reaffirmed intention to further open domestic markets It s rather unusual only Japan mentioned communique promised something Takeshi Saito general manager Fuji Bank Ltd s research division showed how strongly other nations want Japan to take concrete effective steps to redress trade surplus he statement referred to some details Japan s proposed economic measures such as early implementation large supplementary budget exceeding those previous years unprecedented front end loading public works expenditures did mention any figure projected supplementary budget but LDP officials amount to more than billion yen fiscal compares billion provided previous year It signalled clear shift away conservative fiscal policies past Kazuaki Harada senior managing director Sanwa Research Institute five years government stuck to tight fisted fiscal policy attempt to stop issuing deficit financing bonds by But mounting foreign pressure Japan to boost economy hurt by yen s extended rise hurried government to hammer out draft economic package bring to latest G meeting Harada Japan should view expansion economy as result pressure but as opportunity to lead world economic growth The Japanese economy potential to take leadership role we should recognize Harada If Japan fails to meet such international reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC JAPAN CRITICISED FOR

text.title: JAPAN CRITICISED FOR DUMPING OF BANK SERVICES
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: Japan been accused dumping everything steel to computer microchips on world markets now under attack alleged cut throat selling product different sort banking services At meetings here week Bank England officials pressed their Japanese counterparts to change regulations foreign bankers say give their Japanese rivals unfair advantage world financial markets technical banking talks coincided but were separate discussions between Japanese officials British corporate affairs minister Michael Howard who left Tokyo yesterday South Korea At crux talks way regulators various countries measure bank capital how much capital banks must put up to back up their loans generally agreed shareholders equity forms bulwark bank capital but there disagreement what else should be included Some foreign bankers contend their Japanese rivals can undercut them on loans other banking services because Tokyo s capital regulations easier to meet Japanese banks unfair advantage Paul Hofer head Foreign Bankers Association Japan told Reuters Sumitomo Bank Ltd chief economist Masahiko Koido They see us as very aggressive We say we just trying to catch up them Earlier year United States Britain agreed to adopt common regulations requiring banks to put up capital equivalent to at least six pct total assets two countries urged others to follow suit notably Japan But Japanese Finance Ministry officials held out little hope happen soon as they just introduced new regulations governing capital ratios May Under those regulations banks until to attain capital ratio four pct But tacit recognition overseas pressure ministry set six pct target Japanese banks overseas branches But foreign bankers say rub allowed Japan s banks to count pct value their massive holdings Japanese shares their so called hidden reserves as capital Without shares big Japanese banks only capital ratios around three pct them their ratios well above six pct especially after recent record breaking climb Tokyo share prices Western diplomats argue shares valued far too high by ministry Japanese banks never be able to realize anywhere near amount if they were forced to sell shares to raise funds emergency they say Finance Ministry officials defended their stance by saying studies stock market over years show prices rarely fallen below pct value level But U S Federal Reserve seems to think otherwise Japanese officials say Fed effectively held up applications bank licenses by Japanese financial institutions by asking them very detailed accounting their hidden reserves officials say Japan recently raised issue Fed through embassy Washington hoping talks on subject

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC EUROPEAN MARKETS REAC

text.title: EUROPEAN MARKETS REACT QUIETLY TO G COMMUNIQUE
text.author: By Richard Murphy Reuters
text.body: European currency markets reacted quietly to G communique comments bankers dealers ranging disappointment more concrete to surprise markets should expected so much dollar opened lower against virtually all currencies traded narrow range after communique reaffirmed support Paris accord on currency stabilisation but contained no moves to strengthen Dealers Frankfurt Zurich saw dollar remaining broadly entrenched current trading range The dollar likely to stay within range to marks Gisela Steinhaeuser senior dealer at Chase Bank AG She there some resistance to further climbs However she dollar could break out range major surprises such as worse than expected U S Merchandise trade deficit due next Tuesday Theodor Stadelmann dealer Bank Julius Baer Co Ltd Zurich he expects dollar to hold steady against mark Swiss franc but to weaken further against yen possibly to yen Milan banker shared Stadelmann s view saying he expects dollar yen range short term London traders G communique failed to curb underlying bearishness toward dollar but negative sentiment yet strong enough to tempt interbank operators to test downside Concern finance ministers officials still Washington could issue more concrete statements favour currency stabilisation kept players sidelined along worries provoking fresh central bank intervention near term traders Most Paris dealers expressed disappointment at communique saying nothing changed to reverse dollar s downward trend Traders several centres market look fresh opportunities to test willingness central banks to defend current ranges communique were broadly consistent economic fundamentals basic policy intentions outlined at Louvre meeting Dave Jouhin senior dealer at Midland Bank London They re going to put somebody s resolve to test soon U S February trade data may provide trigger dealers However some dealers London based operators be unlikely to open major positions next week ahead long Easter weekend They saw near term technical support at marks yen resistance marks yen Chase Bank s Steinhaeuser other Frankfurt dealers G communique guaranteed relatively calm stable market foreseeable future compared extreme volatility seen first few months year One dealer at German bank wording communique made clear leading nations did want further dollar drop supporting dollar German dealer saw dollar gradually appreciating to marks broadly seen as upper limit within Louvre accord s supposed currency target range Swiss bank economist he believed markets were ready period mainly sideways movement But Milan dealers were sceptical communique contributing to greater stability Nothing changed substantially to give dollar big boost one dealer while another Italian banker he expects dollar to trade between German marks next three months Swiss monetary source who asked to be named communique been line realistic expectations should produced disappointment The problem changes needed fiscal trade policies to redress current imbalances different timescale than currency markets operate on source told Reuters This political process takes time Alois Schwietert chief economist at Swiss Bank Corp Basle also questioned tone disappointment evident on currency markets today Did people really expect patent remedy he asked Bank economists Paris noted yesterday s meeting only first series market watch carefully next few weeks any changes positions senior economist Banque Indosuez focus now on trade growth rather than interest rates Any move by Japan West Germany to boost their economic growth could lead to quick change U S Position Dealers all centres agreed markets be wary pushing dollar too far too quickly coming months while central banks appear resolved to use their muscle to support Paris accord

text.title: GERMAN MONEY MARKET SPLIT ON LOWER RATE PROSPECTS
text.body: Remarks by central bankers raised some hopes Bundesbank cut rates on securities repurchase pacts but operators remained divided on likelihood move near term money market dealers Comments by Bundesbank board member Claus Koehler yesterday rate cuts were needed to curb money supply growth speculative capital inflows by West Berlin state central bank president Dieter Hiss there no natural lower limit to discount rate however no immediate impact Call money declined to pct pct but drop tied to extra liquidity market dealers Dealers Bundesbank s latest liquidity allotment week dashed some hopes lower rates Bundesbank allotted only billion marks yesterday new liquidity repurchase pact at unchanged rate pct thus subtracting some billion marks market as outgoing billion pact expired But some dealers smaller volume awarded by pact line present liquid money market conditions did exlude cut repurchase pact rate soon to pct if money market rates continue at present levels next opportunity Bundesbank to lower rates on repurchase pacts be tender expected next Tuesday Bundesbank officials already they favour more discreet rate adjustments through repurchase pacts rather than more public adjustment leading rates Bundesbank may either set fixed allocation rate allow banks to tender volume as been case since lowered discount rate January or else may allow banks to tender rate set volume itself Dealers expect volume tender to be lower than billion marks flowing out to offset other incoming funds Some seven billion marks expected to flow next week should then flow back into market as deposited banks Banks were well supplied liquidity holding billion marks reserves at Bundesbank on Tuesday Holdings average daily reserves over first seven days April stood at billion marks still above estimated billion required all April

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC U S SAID TO VIEW G

text.title: U S SAID TO VIEW G MEETING AS MAJOR SUCCESS
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: The United States long sought Japanese action to stimulate economy appears to be satisfied Tokyo s latest package major development allows leading industrial nations to reaffirm their agreement to stabilize currencies Monetary sources they believed U S Treasury Secretary James Baker considered Tokyo s package announced yesterday to be major stimulation Japanese economy But yesterday s statement by seven leading industrial powers endorses yen s rise around to dollar level at February Paris Accord to today initial reaction currency markets Far East demonstrates financial markets unconvinced currencies yet reflect economic fundamentals even though countries appear to do so yen sank below at one point despite intervention by Bank Japan Kiichi Miyazawa Japan s Finance Minister movement since Paris consistent currency trading ranges nations agreed to defend February talks I say what happened to yen past several weeks outside range we agreed to discussions Paris Miyazawa yesterday supplementary budget worth billion dlrs announced by ruling Liberal Democratic Party on eve Miyazawa s departure Washington to attend yesterday s meetings leading industrial nations strongly worded statement terming Japanese action extraordinary urgent meeting reaffirmed Paris Accord by noting current exchange rates within ranges broadly consistent fundamentals or economic reality Group Seven United States Japan West Germany France Britain Italy Canada therefore repeated their willingness to continue close cooperation to foster exchange rate stability cooperation agreement resulted concerted central bank intervention billion to billion dlrs to halt dollar s fall While relatively unsuccessful scale intervention between so many nations unprecedented recent years Monetary sources also they understood Secretary Baker considered meeting to be extremely successful light Japanese announcement They also there growing feeling among finance ministers central bankers cooperation over medium term policies replaced bickering over short term differences past meetings West Germany whose currency risen anything like yen since Paris Agreement appears face yesterday s statement to won acceptance other countries exchange rate acceptable Bonn s finance minister Gerhard Stoltenberg argues major currency shifts needed to remedy huge imbalance between West Germany Japan s trade surpluses America s trade deficit already taken place No mention made however U S commitment to cut budget deficit even though implied reafffirmation Paris European nations Japan believe deficit cuts essential to curbing record U S trade shortfall reached nearly billion dlrs year similar argument made on Capitol Hill earlier week by Federal Reserve Board chairman Paul Volcker further sharp fall to redress trade imbalances clearly pose substantial risks renewed inflationary momentum could undermine confidence future financial stability he Volcker warned further dollar fall might force politically independent Fed to drive up interest rates Monetary sources privately West Germany welcomed rise yen against dollar while own currency remained relatively stable against U S unit Bonn other European nations worry once weak dollar blunts Tokyo s export drive to United States Japanese monolith concentrate on European markets ministers meanwhile also continued talks on making their policy coordination more binding one Canadian Finance Minister Michael Wilson good progress made Wilson they meet before June Economic Summit to prepare report leaders seven nations United States France backed by International Monetary Fund want seven to agree on ranges or norms limited number economic objectives such as growth inflation monetary conditions trade balances current account balances Sharp deviations these guidelines result consultations between countries on whether corrective action should be required But inclusion currencies as one objectives Bonn London worried monetary sources say because implies Washington moving direction target zones sources Reagan administration unsuccessfully sounded out allies on system target zones to limit currency fluctuations just before February meeting concept much more rigid one than secret ranges Paris Accord mark sharp departure relatively free currency markets recent years

text.body: The global economy expected to weaken year adding new worries to already serious poverty outlook economic analysts finance ministers central bankers attending week s semi annual meetings International Monetary Fund World Bank new figures released by IMF add additional concern Fund estimated world output only grow by pct year versus pct year pct industrial countries Gross National Product measure all goods services expected to decline to pct year compared pct IMF developing countries Gross Domestic Product another measure economic growth expected to fall to pct pct year new figures considered major disappointment to poorest countries They hoped new vitality industrial countries brought on by sharp decline oil prices assist their economic recovery help them cope growing mounds debt IMF officials discussing their outlook they believed industrial country economies move up to annual growth rate three pct by end decade Economic analysts IMF been saying some time ability to keep debt crisis turning into economic rout rests on sustained economic growth Since debtor countries must look to wealthier states markets their products as well as financial assistance economic weakness developed nations economies poses fundamental worries Debtor countries including very poorest states only few avenues open to them earning foreign exchange including key one exports U S economy fifth year expansion served as mainstay developing country exports but too seen as being rather feeble year growing by only pct according to IMF reason because high trade deficit United States been pressuring Japan West Germany to ignite their economies but little apparent success IMF study also examines course dollar curious lack impact on U S trade deficit Reagan administration officials been saying impact now beginning to show up although been much slower than expected IMF observed World Economic Outlook it to be recognized exchange rate adjustments take time to work through to payments flows probably at least three years to get resonably complete effect report added however the adjustments may take even more time on occasion M

text.title: SPANISH EMPLOYERS WORRIED BY HIGH INTEREST RATES
text.body: The head Spain s employers federation Jose Maria Cuevas employers were worried government s monetary policies because high real interest rates were hampering investment He told news conference wage pacts signed so far year were endangering government s five pct inflation target government s perceived need to control inflation by keeping tight rein on credit unnecessary he High real interest rates were attracting influx speculative foreign capital undercutting government s target monetary growth Cuevas Spain s most closely watched measure money supply liquid assets public hands grew at annualised rate pct March against pct December year target range to pct To combat Bank Spain raised call money rate times so far year to pct at present at end Cuevas employers were heeding government s call to hold wage increases to five pct inflation target year increases salary reviews awarded year new wage pacts averaging pct first quarter These agreements covered less than pct Spanish workers Cuevas rest still wage negotiations He Spain s current wave strikes mainly affected state sector where government trying to impose five pct wage ceiling Cuevas employers were also worried trend Spain s foreign trade balance trade deficit first two months totalled billion pesetas pct increase over corresponding period year However employers did favour devaluation peseta to correct imbalance

text.title: LEAD PRICES RISE ON FINELY BALANCED PHYSICALS
text.author: By Donald Bradshaw Reuters
text.body: Lead prices risen week against background finely balanced physical sector traders Further gains possible if USSR steps up buying or if labour problems develop North America they added London Metal Exchange LME prices unusually buoyant at time year when seasonal demand normally slackening prices tending to drift lower buoyancy generally attributed by traders to low level LME stocks steady if unspectacular physical demand Northern Hemisphere finding supplies curtailed supply problems new but beginning to be felt by market as peak winter demand tails off stocks usually build fast availability increases traders lower supply levels result number different factors around globe Delayed shipments Peru to Mediterranean countries because production transport problems lack Spanish exports since closure year Cia La Cruz s smelter at Linares lower output Morocco Greece all meant additional demand being directed to merchants who turn been drawing on LME stocks addition Broken Hill Associated Smelters Port Pirie South Australia smelter halting production five weeks maintenance Although company meet commitments put further pressure on stocks U S Company Doe Run kept tonnes per year Boss Montana smelter closed cut producer stocks contributed to closer supply demand balance within U S Market many years depressed by surplus production regular supplier to world market Mexican supplies sometimes swelled LME stocks been normal but finding ready buyers traders On demand side winter battery manufacture held up quite well some U S Buying lead sheet been reported U K Soviet lead buying notably absent Europe first two months year resumed when large buying order filled by merchants March Merchant demand fuelled rise LME lead prices week seen cash metal move above stg establish premium around stg over three months delivery Specific demand been directed towards metal Gothenburg Trieste warehouses Gothenburg material often target merchants shipping to USSR traders On stocks popular LME Continental warehouses Antwerp Rotterdam little more than tonnes lead each believed to be strong hands Out total tonnes LME stocks lowest level since June just over half U K Warehouses popular merchants putting together shipments But even U K Stocks dropped around tonnes since start year Traders partly due to secondary smelters buying ingots to supplement feed supplies affected by environmental controls put restrictions on transport used batteries Labour negotiations North America play important part determining direction prices contracts expiring end April at Cominco s Trail Kimberley B C Mine smelter at Doe Run s Herculaneum Mo smelter Noranda s New Brunswick mine smelter also contract expiry July may cause some nervousness view strikes by zinc copper workers over recent months Traders LME three months delivery already attracting speculative buying could rise to stg on current firmness while nearby tightness could widen cash premium to four Three months quoted at stg text.title: LAWSON SAYS SOME COUNTRIES COULD CUT RATES
text.body: Nigel Lawson Britain s Chancellor Exchequer some countries may need to cut interest rates aim maintaining exchange rate stability Speaking to journalists one day after Group Seven countries reaffirmed goals set Paris six weeks ago he central banks continue to intervene as when necessary He G countries were concerned Japan do more to stimulate domestic demand welcomed measures outlined by Japanese Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa yesterday Lawson he still worried risk simultaneous recession United States Japan West Germany though less so than when he gave his March budget speech to British Parliament If anything I m little bit less concerned but there still risk he Asked if United States should consider increasing interest rates to support dollar he If there need changes relative interest rates doesn t need to be rise interest rates United States Lawson there some concern expressed yesterday s meetings at slow progress United States made reducing budget deficit We believe there be some worthwhile progress reducing deficit year important thing continue year after year Lawson February Louvre accord called efforts to stabilize currencies at then current exchange rates six weeks followed Japanese yen continued to rise against dollar despite massive central bank intervention Asked whether intervention sign weakness Louvre accord he I don t think so If there been no intervention you called sign weakness Although intervention could be cause inflation Lawson the world does appear to be inflationary mode but one to be vigilant He yesterday s G statement affirmed current levels exchange rates were appropriate been carefully worded We know what we mean we all mean same thing he Lawson financial markets seem to believe Japanese measures outlined Louvre accord were source weakness agreement Therefore G countries welcomed Miyazawa s presentation plans supplemental budget to stimulate domestic demand They particularly welcomed goal immediate increase public works spending but Lawson package also involved second stage to increase expenditures during second half year

been strictly seasonal end soon They recommend taking profits It s time year strictly seasonal Charles Bradford Merrill Lynch Co Orders be strong two months there signs some order rates starting to dive already But Dean Witter Reynolds Inc analyst Clarence Morrison sees some short term potential group includes USX Corp X Bethlehem Steel Corp BS Armco Inc AS Inland Steel Industries Inc IAD There still some attractiveness to steels over short to intermediate term based on improved order rates rising prices Morrison He only recommends one stock however Inland modernizing steelmaking operations to make them more efficient Despite his bearishness Merrill s Bradford continues to recommend Armco he sees as major turnaround Armco s steelmaking operations profitable balance sheet been improved oilfield equipment business been slimmed put joint venture USX Bradford noted It s high quality investment situation yet but they ve come long way he We think stock do moderately better than market he reuters.unknown: A f reute h f BC JAPAN CRITICISED FOR

text.title: JAPAN CRITICISED FOR DUMPING OF BANK SERVICES
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: Japan been accused dumping everything steel to computer microchips on world markets now under attack alleged cutthroat selling product different sort banking services At meetings here week Bank England officials pressed their Japanese counterparts to change regulations foreign bankers say give their Japanese rivals unfair advantage world financial markets technical banking talks coincided but were separate discussions between Japanese officials British corporate affairs minister Michael Howard who left Tokyo yesterday South Korea At crux talks way regulators various countries measure bank capital how much capital banks must put up to back up their loans generally agreed shareholders equity forms bulwark bank capital but there disagreement what else should be included Some foreign bankers contend their Japanese rivals can undercut them on loans other banking services because Tokyo s capital regulations easier to meet Japanese banks unfair advantage Paul Hofer head Foreign Bankers Association Japan told Reuters Sumitomo Bank Ltd chief economist Masahiko Koido They see us as very aggressive We say we just trying to catch up them Earlier year United States Britain agreed to adopt common regulations requiring banks to put up capital equivalent to at least six pct total assets two countries urged others to follow suit notably Japan But Japanese Finance Ministry officials held out little hope happen soon as they just introduced new regulations governing capital ratios May Under those regulations banks until to attain capital ratio four pct But tacit recognition overseas pressure ministry set six pct target Japanese banks overseas branches But foreign bankers say rub allowed Japan s banks to count pct value their massive holdings Japanese shares their so called hidden reserves as capital Without shares big Japanese banks only capital ratios around three pct them their ratios well above six pct especially after recent record breaking climb Tokyo share prices Western diplomats argue shares valued far too high by ministry Japanese banks never be able to realize anywhere near amount if they were forced to sell shares to raise funds reuters.unknown: C G T f reute d f BC U S TO PUSH STRONG S

text.title: U S TO PUSH STRONG SUMMIT AGRICULTURE STATEMENT
text.author: By Greg McCune Reuters
text.body: The United States push strong statement Western heads of state at June economic summit Venice urging comprehensive negotiations on agriculture begin immediately to reduce domestic farm subsidies senior U S planner summit Agriculture really become number one international economic problem Allen Wallis undersecretary state economic affairs told Reuters interview At Tokyo economic summit year western leaders identified agriculture as major international problem but made no specific recommendations year Wallis U S press statement instructing trade ministers to begin negotiating on issue include domestic programs While Western leaders including president Reagan conduct specific negotiations Wallis they can give push to agriculture talks under General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT Wallis leaders should endorse comprehensive negotiation interpreted as including domestic policies as well as import restraints export subsidies They GATT talks really to deal domestic policies as well as trade arrangements Wallis Trade Representative Clayton Yeutter summit statement support agriculture talks part overall U S strategy to build momentum GATT farm talks Public statements recent weeks by several members Reagan cabinet stressed agriculture issue Yeutter Agriculture Secretary Richard Lyng repeatedly discuss agriculture during visit to Japan starting next week Yeutter agriculture also be on agenda trade ministers quadrilateral talks among Japan European Community U S Canada month ministerial meeting Paris based Organization Economic Cooperation Development OECD May highlight agriculture problem Yeutter OECD May expected to release study domestic farm subsidies shows Japan highest subsidies among industrial countries but aid to farmers also generous EC United States controversial OECD study calculated measure farm subsidies called Producer Subsidy Equivalent PSE allows farm aid to be compared across countries Some officials including British Agriculture Minister Michael Jopling PSE could be useful as method negotiating lower domestic farm subsidies worldwide However State Department s Wallis while PSE can be useful negotiations shortcomings its definitive He other U S officials Reagan administration yet reached decision on specific U S agriculture proposal to present to GATT I expect U S proposal to be fall after series international meetings Wallis At preliminary meetings GATT agriculture committee United States pushed so called freeze rollback approach Subsidies first be frozen at current levels then rolled back jointly stages However Reagan administration perplexed some trade analysts recently by reacting cooly to plan by Australian prime minister Bob Hawke calling similar approach Hawke unveiled seven point plan to freeze subsequently reduce gap between high farm price supports world prices Australia leading so called Cairns group coutries pressing freer agriculture trade The proposals so called Cairns group coming up seem to be focusing on short run quick fixes what we think what s called here Wallis Wallis other U S wants long range solution to agriculture problem U S officials also criticized Australian proposal because they deals primarily difference between domestic prices world levels EC U S but fails to focus on question market access At same time U S rejecting Australian quick fix Wallis U S press at summit declaration urging agriculture talks be completed expeditiously or within two years unstated U S strategy U S officials to keep pressure on EC year through export enhancement program lower value dollar hope sweeping agriculture agreement possible

indicate consumer activity slowing but does appear to be because liquidity employment rising analyst Jeff Edelman analyst Drexel Lambert Burnham Overall analysts first half sales coming according to text.author: By Norma Cohen Reuters
text.body: Eurodollar bonds closed as much as full point lower as dollar fell to post war low against yen interest rates on U S Treasuries rose almost to eight pct dollar fell to yen recovered only slightly after foreign exchange traders New York Federal Reserve intervened to buy dollars yen But despite dollar s woes Japan Development Bank wholly owned by Japanese government raised dlrs seven year eurobond carrying eight pct coupon Lead manager issue Bank Tokyo deal at time pricing to yield basis points over comparable maturity Treasuries However by close trading spread narrowed to continued to slide aftermarket activity Dealers noted spread to Treasuries wide newly priced AAA rated borrower like Japan Development Bank example earlier week World Bank raised U S Dlrs at only basis points over Treasuries Dealers because borrower comes to market fairly infrequently time nine months ago spread appears wide But officials at Bank Tokyo spread intended to compensate lack liquidity uncertainty currently associated owning dollar securities officials borrower opted to raise funds dollars despite currency s weakness because only market deep enough to accommodate issue size Japan Development Bank allowed to raise euroyen Market sources deal likely to be swapped into yen as borrowers previous issues were Late day deal trading just inside fees at less less Also issued today dlr five year offering Toshiba International Finance Netherlands carrying pct coupon priced at Three equity linked dollar denominated deals were offered largest dlr offering by Sekisui Chemical Co guaranteed by Sanwa Bank Ltd issue equity warrants attached late day quoted on brokers screens at bid only Australian dollar market continued active Canadian Imperial Bank Commerce offering bond five year zero coupon priced at Late day deal quoted at less bid similar deal yesterday by Toronto Dominion priced slightly higher at pct effective yield pct quoted slightly lower at less less pct Dealers investors apparently willing to accept zero coupon bonds yielding to basis points less than annual pay bonds because their tax benefits retail buyers Also bonds more volatile if interest rates fall Australia as many analysts expect potential capital gains greater zero coupon bonds also better those who expect australian dlr to appreciate Dealers Australia dlr zero coupon bonds apparently being placed retail accounts on European continent very little placement being done Japan Euroyen issues sank slightly line prices on domestic Japanese bond markets but recovered late trade as yen soared After markets closed dollar fell to yen European Investment Bank EIB issued euroyen issue paying pct over seven years second seven year yen issue two days sector yield curve Japan dealers feel yet become overpriced

text.body: Reducing amount crop base farmer can receive deficiency payments on being looked at as one way to cut U S agriculture budget fiscal year congressional aides lobbyists Rep Charles Stenholm D Tex suggested planted crop base producer receives deficiency payments on be reduced by five pct aide to Stenholm aide no official proposal yet been drawn up but as becomes more clear exactly how much agriculture spending to reduced specific numbers be discussed proposal could very likely be drafted Under proposal if farmer idled pct his acreage base eligible to plant remaining pct he receive payments on only pct his total base Current regulations provide farmers deficiency payments on pct their non idled acreage Reducing payment base by five pct could save around to dlrs but to be applied to crop programs order any savings to accrue fiscal year Agriculture Department economist Stenholm s aide when proposal officially offered likely be amendment to budget reconciliation bill Other options currently being talked as way to cut one to two billion dlrs farm budget include increasing acreage reduction programs limiting farm payments implementing acreage set aside program or limiting use generic kind certificates

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC SWISS AGREE ON NEW PR

text.title: SWISS AGREE ON NEW PROSPECTUS RULES FOR NOTES
text.author: By Peter Conradi
text.body: Swiss franc notes issued after May must be provided prospectus virtually erasing difference information requirements between notes public bonds according to convention drafted by Bankers Federation convention requires lead managers draw up prospectus naming all syndicate members providing certain details borrower contrast to public issues though prospectus must merely be made available to clients on request via all syndicate banks rather than published distributed printed form convention approved by banks earlier month replaces earlier convention dating deals what been widely seen as increasingly anachronistic distinction between notes public issues publication follows long debate among bankers on amount information should be provided by borrowers heightened by difficulties Swiss franc issues here on recent occasions applies to all notes units at least Swiss francs usual denomination placed directly customers by syndicate quoted on bourse Anything smaller than francs be governed by unchanged more demanding rules apply to public issues Bankers contacted by Reuters they did envisage new requirement present them problems or push up fees Many banks they some time been providing more than legal minimum information Traditionally notes or private placements as they were also known were medium term instruments denominated francs placed largely institutional investors They were normally brought onto open market never quoted on stock exchange But over years distinction between notes publicly quoted traded bonds gradually broke down National Bank therefore May abolished all remaining restrictions on maturities denominations still formally divided them However competence National Bank to rule on prospectuses banks since continued largely as before public issues generally quoted on stock exchanges been provided detailed prospectuses while notes virtually always quoted been equipped only information memorandums varying degrees detail new convention attempts to put end to says each notes prospectus must contain following seven points precise terms issue Details company performance if more than six months since annual report Naming all guarantors source information Details ratings insofar as they been made equity linked notes details where company s shares listed price high lows over at least three years lead manager required borrower to provide information during lifetime notes on progress his business According to figures Swiss Bank Corp total note issues by foreign borrowers reached billion Swiss francs year compared billion francs borrowed form public bonds majority note issues were Japanese borrowers

text.title: CANADA TRADE RISE SEEN AS START OF RECOVERY
text.author: By Russell Blinch Reuters
text.body: Canada s trade picture brightened considerably underscoring economists predictions sector post long awaited recovery year federal government reported today monthly surplus soared to billion Canadian dlrs February double January s dlrs surplus sharply higher than February s dlr tally Hopefully s beginning trend Richardson Greenshields Canada Ltd economist Susan Clark Toronto Economists generally don t expect such large gains over next months but looking upward trend throughout year We thought trade balance improve over year certainly looks as if morning s figure indicative commented economist James Donegan at Toronto securities firm Midland Doherty Ltd Statistics Canada reported surplus driven by pct gain automobile product exports to record billion dls month Recovery automotive sector helped push value exports up by pct February agency monthly report Total exports expanded to billion dlrs billion dlrs February while imports slipped to billion dlrs billion dlrs Economists predicted trade surplus end up three to five billion dlrs higher than year s dismal billion dlr total surplus billion dlrs Money market analysts positive trade news touched off modest rally Canadian dollar rose to U S cts on North American markets early morning after closing at cts Wednesday currency hovering around cts early afternoon trading Economists been banking on improved trade performance year to stimulate otherwise sluggish Canadian economy Money market analysts positive trade news touched off modest rally Canadian dollar rose to U S cts on North American markets early morning after closing at cts Wednesday currency hovering around cts early afternoon trading Economists been banking on improved trade performance year to stimulate otherwise sluggish Canadian economy They say reuters.unknown: RM F A f reute u f AM DEBT ARGENTINA

text.title: ARGENTINA WARNS IT MAY CUT OFF TALKS WITH BANKS
text.author: By David Hume Reuters
text.body: Argentina s Economy Minister Juan Sourrouille narrow interest creditor banks holding up accord to stretch out debt repayments warned Argentina may break off negotiations It inadmissible private narrow interest some banks threatens to turn into insurmountable obstacle policy we agreed international community Sourrouille Speaking to International Monetary Fund s Interim Committee meeting Sourrouille Argentina given ample proof negotiating seriously banks Today same responsibility we clearly stating be imposible us to continue negotiating on basis monetary source who heard Sourrouille s speech vantage point close to U S Treasury Secretary James Baker Baker turned to one his advisors to ask names banks Sourrouille were stalling on agreement Let s give them call right away source quoted Baker as saying Sourrouille reminded Interim Committee IMF February approved billion dlr stand by loan longer term credit known as extended Fund Facility another dlrs But he despite Argentina s disciplined effort to achieve inflation free economic growth unable to obtain IMF payouts due to link between arrangement settlement separate agreement creditor banks Sourrouille stated flatly banks were flouting long established practice under debtor countries reached agreements on economic reforms Fund were good credit risk banks In other words facts demonstrating current debt strategy showing IMF agreement only weak signal beginning another discussion with banks he stated He added fact strategy working also demonstrated when governments approved Argentina s program to join bridge loan his country Sourrouille stated Argentina met IMF requirements regarding balance payments monetary fiscal policies Despite Sourrouille What we facing inexplicable demands from banks blocking negotations Argentina foreign debt billion dlrs been seeking to reschdule billion dlrs old debt another billion dlrs been refinanced minister also there were two issues separating Argentina
